issue.title: ~/# key doesn't work
issue.body:
I'm running alacritty on Fedora 25. Wayland is used for GDM but my session is running Xorg.

When I press the ~/# key, nothing happens, either with shift or without. All the other keys seem to work OK. It's a UK keyboard layout so ~/# is next to Enter.

xev reports the keypress events correctly:

```
KeyPress event, serial 36, synthetic NO, window 0x2e00001,
    root 0xd5, subw 0x0, time 11055582, (1071,521), root:(1204,713),
    state 0x10, keycode 51 (keysym 0x23, numbersign), same_screen YES,
    XLookupString gives 1 bytes: (23) "#"
    XmbLookupString gives 1 bytes: (23) "#"
    XFilterEvent returns: False
KeyRelease event, serial 36, synthetic NO, window 0x2e00001,
    root 0xd5, subw 0x0, time 11055747, (1071,521), root:(1204,713),
    state 0x10, keycode 51 (keysym 0x23, numbersign), same_screen YES,
    XLookupString gives 1 bytes: (23) "#"
    XFilterEvent returns: False
```

Have I done something daft?

body: Probably related to #209, but a bit different. On swedish layout, macOS the terminal stops responding when entering '´'
This issue appeared after fixing the problem with non-ascii character typing in issue #87. It's mentioned there too.

issue.title: Unable to type Unicode characters on 105-key Norwegian (bokmål) keyboard
issue.body:
alacritty is apparently unable to type Unicode characters, such as æøå. On the empty lines in the attached screenshot, I’ve tried typing “æøå“.

Interestingly, it _is_ possible to paste Unicode characters into the terminal.

![screenshot-2017-01-06-194218](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/399120/21730571/3ece0778-d448-11e6-939c-d6c87e536903.png)

body: The duplication may be happening due to [this block](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/src/input.rs#L358-L360) not being hit when the `Option<VirtualKeyCode>` is `None`.

Hi @jwilm, I would like to give this issue a try, since I'm learning rust and this bug really make alacritty unusable for me, since every dead key is printed twice (even ^ and ~). Can you point me to where to start looking? Thanks

@michelboaventura keyboard input processing is handled [here](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/src/input.rs#L391-L420). It might be good to see what events are actually being sent to Alacritty too; try running with `--print-events`.
@michelboaventura feel free to message me here or on IRC if you have more questions. Thanks for looking into this!

issue.title: Allacritty hangs when dead key is pressed or emoji keyboard is opened on macOS
issue.body:
For the definition of the somewhat unusual phrase "dead key", see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_key

I didn't know until looking it up a few minutes ago, but a dead key is one which does not produce a character itself, but combines with the next character pressed. In macOS `option-e` is a dead key that combines with vowels to give them an acute accent: `option-e + o = ó`

Anyways, long story short, alacritty hangs on macOS when any dead key is pressed. It doesn't crash, since the process doesn't exit, but the window freezes and ignores input. I tried option + `e`, `u`, `i`, `n`, and backtick, and they all crashed.

I ran it under lldb, `ctrl-c`-ed after doing it to get to the debugger prompt, and captured this backtrace:

https://gist.github.com/casey/7eb6c2d967da370f106a8d8c5d9761d6

It appears to be waiting for an event which never comes. Kind of sad, really :'–(

(Mach ports and messages are the low-level kernel provided mechanism through which much IPC happens on macOS.)

Also of note is that this happens when you press `command-control-space`, which opens the emoji keyboard on macOS. I captured a stack trace for this, and it appears to be identical.

Obviously, emoji keyboard functionality is of near paramount importance, since without it it is very difficult to include cute emoji in my git commit messages.

body:
@michelboaventura That is some grade-A research! Fantastic job tracking this down. Bonus points for the bonus issue 👍 .

The thing to do with these fixes is upstream them to

1. My fork of Glutin
2. The winit library, which we will hopefully be using soon.

Here's the [Glutin fork](https://github.com/jwilm/glutin), and you'll want the [`keyboard-mods` branch](https://github.com/jwilm/glutin/tree/keyboard-mods). After the patch lands on that branch, we can update Alacritty.

@jwilm, thanks mate. Every time I decide to move from C I always end up debugging C code/documentation :)

I've created the PR on the glutin fork and will to the same on winit. Someone seems to had already tracked the same issue down there: https://github.com/tomaka/winit/issues/107

Speaking of winit, are you planning to move from glutin to winit? If so, I could give it also a try.

Cheers
@michelboaventura winit is in the middle of a big API change. I'm hoping that we can get all of our features in before that is released and then switch once it's released.
Oh, I landed your PR on my fork, and Alacritty can now be updated. I can do this later or if you make a PR I'll push the merge button whenever it shows up.
@jwilm you mean a PR to update glutin on Cargo.toml?
